heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 08 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 5.6°C) and outside temperature (up 5.2°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 429 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 754 m), light levels (up 2889 lux), and inside temperature (up 2.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 429.1m lower than yesterday, 568.7m lower than the past week, 753.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 696m and a peak of 1841m, averaging 825.6m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

dew point temperature.description:
Today’s average dew point temperature is 6.0°C higher than yesterday, 1.5°C higher than the past week, 1.3°C higher than the past month.

The dew point temperatures for yesterday ranged from -0.5°C to 9.8°C and averaged 10.3°C, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

pressure.description:
Today’s average pressure is 1.8 mbar lower than yesterday, 1.0 mbar higher than the past week, 8.6 mbar higher than the past month.

The pressures yesterday fell between 1026 mbar minimum and 1029 mbar maximum, with an average of 1025.7 mbar; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1024.7 mbar and 1017.1 mbar.
pressure.summary: Expect stable weather patterns due to high pressure.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, air moisture should feel ok and little or no wind. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and some sunny spells will occur. Stable weather patterns due to high pressure.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (89%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
